main event: A civilian reported observing a reddish-orange flame resembling a V-2 rocket over Valdosta, Georgia, on July 20, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed for a total of 7 minutes during its ascent., The observer was a World War II veteran with prior experience of V-2 rockets., The observer initially thought the object was moving rapidly but noted its speed decreased as it gained altitude., The object was described to have a flame-like appearance., A local newspaper staff member received a phone call from an excited person mentioning the fiery object.
sighted object: reddish-orange flame resembling a V-2 rocket
witness description: A local engraver and his wife, both observing the object from their yard.
